results.title: Amlodipine in the current management of hypertension
results.text_hl: It has proven to reduce BP variability and successfully lower BP. @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@Amlodipine@@@ also controls BP in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with a systolic/diastolic BP of 130/80 mm Hg or higher, @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetes@@@, or @<m>DISEASE_Renal_Insufficiency_Chronic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D051436 @@@chronic kidney disease@@@ without worsening glycemic or kidney function.

citations.NLM: Wang JG, Palmer BF, Vogel Anderson K, Sever P. Amlodipine in the current management of hypertension J Clin Hypertens (Greenwich). 2023 Aug 7;():. PMID: 37551050
citations.BibTeX: @article{37551050, title={Amlodipine in the current management of hypertension}, author={Wang JG and Palmer BF and Vogel Anderson K and Sever P}, journal={J Clin Hypertens (Greenwich)}}

results.title: Protective Effects of Amlodipine Pretreatment on Contrast-Induced Acute Kidney Injury And Overall Survival In Hypertensive Patients
results.text_hl: Finally, we conducted a subgroup analysis of the protective effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ in high-risk groups such as @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetes@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Renal_Insufficiency_Chronic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D051436 @@@CKD@@@, and the aged.

citations.NLM: Yin WJ, Zhou LY, Li DY, Xie YL, Wang JL, Zuo SR, Liu K, Hu C, Zhou G, Chen LH, Yang HQ, Zuo XC. Protective Effects of Amlodipine Pretreatment on Contrast-Induced Acute Kidney Injury And Overall Survival In Hypertensive Patients Front Pharmacol. 2020;11():44. PMID: 32116719
citations.BibTeX: @article{32116719, title={Protective Effects of Amlodipine Pretreatment on Contrast-Induced Acute Kidney Injury And Overall Survival In Hypertensive Patients}, author={Yin WJ and Zhou LY and Li DY and Xie YL and Wang JL and Zuo SR and Liu K and Hu C and Zhou G and Chen LH and Yang HQ and Zuo XC}, journal={Front Pharmacol}, volume={11}, pages={44}}

results.title: Association of Amlodipine with the Risk of In-Hospital Death in Patients with COVID-19 and Hypertension: A Reanalysis on 184 COVID-19 Patients with Hypertension
results.text_hl: For the first analysis (55 @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@Amlodipine@@@ versus 129 n-@<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@Amlodipine@@@), five univariate logistic regressions reported significant associations between mortality and age, @<m>DISEASE_Renal_Insufficiency_Chronic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D051436 @@@chronic kidney disease@@@, @DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@malignant neoplasm@@@, @DISEASE_Dementia @DISEASE_MESH:D003704 @@@dementia@@@, and @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ status.

citations.NLM: Loas G, Van de Borne P, Darquennes G, Le Corre P. Association of Amlodipine with the Risk of In-Hospital Death in Patients with COVID-19 and Hypertension: A Reanalysis on 184 COVID-19 Patients with Hypertension Pharmaceuticals (Basel). 2022 Mar 21;15(3):. PMID: 35337177

results.title: Amlodipine improves symmetric dimethylarginine in dogs with chronic kidney disease.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@Amlodipine@@@ improves @CHEMICAL_symmetric_dimethylarginine @CHEMICAL_MESH:C024917 @@@symmetric dimethylarginine@@@ in @SPECIES_9615 @@@dogs@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Renal_Insufficiency_Chronic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D051436 @@@chronic kidney disease@@@.

results.title: Evaluation of Renin-Angiotensin-Aldosterone System Components and Enzymes in Systemically Hypertensive Cats Receiving Amlodipine
results.text_hl: We hypothesized that naturally @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@SHT@@@ @SPECIES_9685 @@@cats@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Renal_Insufficiency_Chronic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D051436 @@@chronic kidney disease@@@ receiving chronic @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ therapy would show RAAS activation compared to NT @SPECIES_9685 @@@cats@@@.

results.title: Amlodipine Compared with Benidipine in the Management of Hypertension: A Systematic Review and Meta-Analysis.
results.text_hl: INTRODUCTION: @CHEMICAL_benidipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:C061004 @@@Benidipine@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ are two well-known drugs used in @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Renal_Insufficiency_Chronic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D051436 @@@chronic kidney disease@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Renal_Insufficiency_Chronic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D051436 @@@CKD@@@).

citations.NLM: Sofy AA, Abdelsattar AT, Mohammed OM, Shareef MA, Alamodi AA, Nso N, Payton M, Masoud AT. Amlodipine Compared with Benidipine in the Management of Hypertension: A Systematic Review and Meta-Analysis. High Blood Press Cardiovasc Prev. 2020 Dec;27(6):527-537. PMID: 33001356

results.title: Amlodipine Improves Vessel Function and Remodeling in the Lewis Polycystic Kidney Rat Mesenteric Artery.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSIONS: Our results indicate that blockade of LTCCs with @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ is effective in improving, to a certain extent, detrimental structural and functional vascular features of resistance arteries in @<m>DISEASE_Renal_Insufficiency_Chronic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D051436 @@@CKD@@@.

citations.NLM: Quek KJ, Ameer OZ, Phillips JK. Amlodipine Improves Vessel Function and Remodeling in the Lewis Polycystic Kidney Rat Mesenteric Artery. Am J Hypertens. 2020 Jul 18;33(7):634-643. PMID: 32215654

results.title: Classical and alternative renin-angiotensin-aldosterone systems in a feline remnant kidney model.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@Amlodipine@@@-treated @<m>DISEASE_Renal_Insufficiency_Chronic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D051436 @@@CKD@@@ @SPECIES_9685 @@@cats@@@ had higher concentrations of all RAAS markers than their nonhypertensive, @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@-naive counterparts.

citations.NLM: Huang JHC, Lourenço BN, Schmiedt CW, Coleman AE. Classical and alternative renin-angiotensin-aldosterone systems in a feline remnant kidney model. Am J Vet Res. 2025 Aug 14;():1-11. PMID: 40816319
